 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 2.4 - NAVIGABLE
HEADINGS AND LABELS(LEVEL AA)
On accessible websites...

Headings and labels describe topic or purpose. 

These websites...

Provide ways to help users navigate, find content, and determine where they are.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
 A form asking the name of the user 

A form asks the name of the user. It consists of two input fields to ask for the
first and last name. The first field is labeled "First name", the second is
labeled "Last name"." 

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/headings-and-labels.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
